result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Detainer placed at: Dodge Correctional Institution;  
**sent via email on 11-04-2022, with attached criminal complaint

ADDRESS INFO for Lorenzo D Kyles
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

8:29 AM Defendant Lorenzo D Kyles in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Lorenzo D Kyles.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense requests a preliminary hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Vincent Strom, of the Menomonee Falls Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  
Cross examination by attorney Gutierrez.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over with no argument.  
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If defendant has a passport, Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant (Kwasi J Robinson) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

2:26 PM Defendant Lorenzo D Kyles in court, in custody. Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Lorenzo D Kyles.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
 Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
